actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Ogles amendment (A070) Roll Call 593
actions-list.actionItem: Recorded vote pending.
On agreeing to the Westerman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 838, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Westerman amendment No. 131.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Westerman,  numbered 131 printed in Part A of House Report 118-261 to prohibit the use of funds for the development, implementation, and interagency coordination of an Ocean Justice Strategy.
On agreeing to the Stauber amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 838, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Stauber amendment No. 130.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Stauber,  numbered 130 printed in Part A of House Report 118-261 to prohibit any funds from being used to finalize, implement, or enforce the Administration's proposed NEPA Phase 2 regulations.
On agreeing to the Stauber amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 838, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Stauber amendment No. 129.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Stauber,  numbered 129 printed in Part A of House Report 118-261 to prohibit any funds from being used to implement or enforce the Administration's NEPA Phase 1 regulations.
On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment; Failed by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 838, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Schweikert amendment No. 128.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Schweikert,  numbered 128 printed in Part A of House Report 118-261 to reduce discretionary budget authority in the bill by 16 percent.

At the conclusion of debate on the Roy amendment No. 127, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 838, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Roy amendment No. 127.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Roy,  numbered 127 printed in Part A of House Report 118-261 to prohibit funds from being used to implement any of the Administration's executive orders on climate change.

At the conclusion of debate on the Roy amendment No. 126, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Pingree demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 838, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Roy amendment No. 126.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Roy,  numbered 126 printed in Part A of House Report 118-261 to prohibit funds from being used to carry out environmental justice activities.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4821 â€” "Making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Gottheimer to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
